name: Shimba Hills National Reserve
shortDescription: Kenya's largest coastal rainforest with 700 elephants (the country's highest density), rare sable antelopes found nowhere else in Kenya, and Shimba Hills Lodge - the only tree lodge on the coast.
fullDescription:
Shimba Hills National Reserve features elephants and sable antelopes in one of the largest coastal rainforests remaining in East Africa. Located in Kwale County, approximately 33 kilometers southwest of Mombasa, the reserve provides a lush, green contrast to the nearby beaches and offers a completely different ecosystem just a short drive from the coast.

Shimba Hills is home to about 700 elephants, representing the greatest density of African elephants in Kenya. The reserve serves as a vital migration corridor for elephants as it borders Mwaluganje Elephant Sanctuary, ensuring these majestic animals have protected routes between feeding and watering areas. Visitors have excellent chances of close elephant encounters in the dense forest settings.

The park has unique numbers of sable antelope - a magnificent creature with long curved horns found in no other park in Kenya. These rare and beautiful antelopes are critically endangered, making Shimba Hills their last refuge in the country. The combination of coastal rainforest habitat and protected status provides crucial sanctuary for this species.

Shimba Hills Lodge is the only tree lodge on Kenya's coast, built on stilts and overlooking a waterhole that attracts elephants, buffaloes, and antelopes throughout the day and night. The lodge is nestled in the tropical rainforest with a large veranda overlooking the waterhole, giving visitors a unique opportunity to enjoy breathtaking wildlife viewing without leaving the comfort of the lodge.

Beyond elephants and sable antelopes, the reserve supports leopards, buffalos, warthogs, bushpigs, waterbucks, and over 250 bird species, making it an exceptional destination for wildlife enthusiasts seeking a rainforest safari experience.
activities: Elephant viewing (700 elephants, Kenya's highest density)
Sable antelope tracking (found nowhere else in Kenya)
24-hour wildlife viewing from Shimba Hills Lodge
